intro: Margaretta rosea subsp. whytei, commonly known as the Whyte's margaret rose, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Rosaceae family and is characterized by its showy, double pink to white blooms. The plant typically grows as a shrub with thorny stems and elliptical, dark green leaves. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, often found in rocky or sandy habitats. The flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
